title: Breezeblocks - Alt-J (2012)
brief_description:
A music video was created to accompany the release of the song Breezeblocks by Alt-J. Directed by Ellis Bahl and starring actors Jonathan Dwyer, Jessica DiGiovanni, and Eleanor Pienta, and it is the band’s first official music video.

The video features a violent fight in an apartment between a male and a female character shown in reverse, beginning with the death of the female character at the hands of the male character, who bludgeons her with a breeze block. As the fight progresses backwards, it is revealed that the female character is the aggressor in the fight, having ambushed the male character as he returned home to discover his presumptive wife bound and gagged.

The video aired for the first time on YouTube on 23 March 2012. As of October 2019, it has over 199 million views. The video won at the UK Music Video Awards for “Best Alternative Video” on 8 November 2012.

constellations_other.name: Time to rewind (The Gardens Between)
constellations_other.description: This constellation explores media works that manipulate time, specifically by utitlising a reverse play structure to tell a story.

description: “Breezeblocks” is a song by British indie rock band alt-J from their debut studio album An Awesome Wave (2012). The song was released on 18 May 2012 as the album’s second single.
description_for_label: “Breezeblocks” is a song by British indie rock band alt-J from their debut studio album An Awesome Wave (2012). The song was released on 18 May 2012 as the album’s second single.
